Class Room

java.lang.Object
  Room

public class Room
extends java.lang.Object

Class Room - a room in an adventure game. This class is part of the "World of Zuul" application. "World of Zuul" is a very simple, text based adventure game. A "Room" represents one location in the scenery of the game. It is connected to other rooms via exits. The exits are made by the setExit method.

Version:
April 26, 2010
Author:
Logan Lowder (orginally based off code by Michael Kolling and David J. Barnes)

Constructor Detail

Room

public Room(java.lang.String description)
Create a room described "description". Initially, it has no exits. "description" is something like "a kitchen" or "an open court yard".

Parameters:
description - The room's description.
Method Detail

getDescription

public java.lang.String getDescription()
Used to find the description of the room.

Returns:
The description of the room.

getExit

public Room getExit(java.lang.String direction)
Gets an the exit in a direction for that room.

Parameters:
direction - The direction to search for an exit.
Returns:
A room if an exit in that direction exists, otherwise returns null.

getExitString

public java.lang.String getExitString()
Returns a description of the room's exits, for example, "Exits: north west".

Returns:
A description of the available exits.

getItem

public Item getItem(java.lang.String itemName)
Returns an item if it is currently in the room.

Parameters:
itemName - The name of the item you wish to get from the room.
Returns:
Returns the item if it is in the room, otherwise returns null.

getLongDescription

public java.lang.String getLongDescription()
Return a long description of this room, of the form: You are in the kitchen. Exits: north west

Returns:
A description of the room, including exits.

hasItem

public boolean hasItem(java.lang.String name)
Tells whether or not a certain item is in this room.

Parameters:
name - The name of the item to check for.
Returns:
Returns true if the item is in the room, false if it isn't.

placeItem

public void placeItem(Item item)
Takes an existing item and adds and adds it to the room.

Parameters:
item - The item to add to the room.

placeItem

public void placeItem(java.lang.String name,
                      int itemWeight,
                      java.lang.String itemInfo)
Creates an item and places it into the room.

Parameters:
name - The name of the item.
itemWeight - The weight of the item represented by an int.
itemInfo - The String you want the player to read when he/she sees the item. For example, "Ye seeth, a shiny ring."

removeItem

public void removeItem(Item name)
Removes an item from the room.

Parameters:
name - The name of the item to remove.

setExit

public void setExit(java.lang.String direction,
                    Room neighbor)
Sets up whatever exit to add to the room.

Parameters:
direction - The direction in which the exit is located.
neighbor - The room which lies through that exit.
